text: Saint Justinian is the name of: *Byzantine emperor Justinian I (483–565), saint in the Eastern Orthodox tradition *Saint Justinian of Ramsey Island (also Stinan, Jestin or Iestin, died 6th-century), hermit who lived on Ramsey Island, near St. David's, Pembrokeshire, Wales *Saint Lawrence Justinian (1381–1456), Bishop and first Patriarch of Venice *St Justinian, coastal location in Pembrokeshire, Wales
title: Saint Justinian
